class_description:
Each index in an index path represents the index into an array of children from one node in the tree to another, deeper, node. For example, the index path 1.4.3.2 specifies the path shown in Figure 1.
Index path 1.4.3.2
Note
The UIKit framework adds programming interfaces to the NSIndexPath class of the Foundation framework to facilitate the identification of rows and sections in UITableView objects and the identification of items and sections in UICollectionView objects. The API consists of class factory methods and properties for accessing the various indexed values. You use the factory methods to create an index path for the corresponding table view or collection view.
Important
The Swift overlay to the Foundation framework provides the IndexPath structure, which bridges to the NSIndexPath class. For more information about value types, see Working with Cocoa Frameworks in Using Swift with Cocoa and Objective-C (Swift 4.1).

Methods.method_description: Initializes an index path with a single node.

params.param_description: Index of the item in node 0 to point to.

return_description: Initialized NSIndexPath object representing a one-node index path with index.

Methods.method_description: Initializes an index path with the given nodes and length.

params.param_description: Array of indexes to make up the index path.
Number of nodes to include in the index path.

return_description: Initialized NSIndexPath object with indexes up to length.

Methods.method_description: Initializes an index path with the indexes of a specific row and section in a table view.

params.param_description: An index number identifying a row in a UITableView object in a section identified by section.
An index number identifying a section in a UITableView object.

Methods.method_description: Initializes an index path with the indexes of a specific item and section in a collection view.

params.param_description: An index number identifying an item in a UICollectionView object in a section identified by the section parameter.
An index number identifying a section in a UICollectionView object.

Methods.method_description: Returns an index path containing the nodes in the receiving index path plus another given index.

params.param_description: Index to append to the index path’s indexes.

return_description: A new index path containing the receiving index path’s indexes and index.

Methods.method_description: Returns an index path with the nodes in the receiving index path, excluding the last one.

return_description: A new index path with the receiving index path’s indexes, excluding the last one.

Methods.method_description: Indicates the depth-first traversal order of the receiving index path and another index path.

return_description: The depth-first traversal ordering of the receiving index path and indexPath.

Methods.method_description: Provides the value at a particular node in the index path.

return_description: The index value at node or NSNotFound if the node is outside the range of the index path.

Methods.method_description: Copies the indexes stored in the index path from the positions specified by the position range into the specified indexes.

params.param_description: Pointer to a C array of at least as many NSUInteger objects as specified by the length of positionRange. On return, the array holds the index path's indexes.
A range of valid positions within the index path. If the location plus the length of positionRange is greater than the length of the index path, this method raises an rangeException.

Methods.method_declar: func getIndexes(_ indexes: UnsafeMutablePointer<Int>, range positionRange: NSRange)

Methods.method_description: Copies the objects contained in the index path into indexes.DeprecatedUse getIndexes(_:range:) instead.

params.param_description: Pointer to a C array of objects of size at least the length of the index path. On return, the index path’s indexes.

Vars.var_description: An index number identifying a section in a table view or collection view.
An index number identifying a row in a section of a table view.
An index number identifying an item in a section of a collection view.
The number of nodes in the index path.
